runs.comm: swing first up. Too full, middle and leg, defended back to him
more swing but not as much as Porterfield expects. This is on a length, just outside off. Porterfield plays the off-stump channel, and is beaten on the outside edge
this is full and outside off, inviting a drive, but Porterfield resists
on a length, outside off, just holds its line. Porterfield lets it go
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for a single
on a length, angling in towards the stumps, defended towards mid-on
full, swinging into the pads, pushed firmly to mid-on
floated outside off, just within the tram lines, left alone
this one is angled too far across, and the ball seams away after pitching. Called wide
pulled away. That is crunched. Clean out of the screws. Short, at 140ks, not even waist high, and he has disdainfully pulled it over midwicket
fuller, shapes up as one that will swing back in, but keeps on going after pitching. Left alone
pulled away to long leg for two. Can't bowl short if the ball is not coming up
short of a length, just outside off, seams away, left alone
stays full, around off, gets slight movement back in, defended to leg
wide half-volley, pushed wide of mid-off. Not a powerful drive, just leaning into the push
short of a length, just outside off, he is no the front foot, and ends up in an undesirable position. Is cramped for room with the ball coming back in. Keeps it out, though
pushed wide of cover for one
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
full, starts around off, goes with the angle, pushed to cover
full and straight, defended to mid-on
stays on a length, around off, defended to leg as the ball angles in

he has played across the line. What a big mistake. Loses patience. Given. He is on the middle-and-off line, Adil stays on that length and within the stumps, Stirling goes across the line, presenting only half the bat, and is beaten. Hit in front. Even if the ball goes on with the angle, it will clip leg. They think of it, but don't review the decision
short of a length, holds its line in front of off, hits the pad, but it is bouncing over
on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
lovely shot. Square drive. On the up. This is a length ball outside off, there is width, and he just goes after it. Middles it and beats point
full, on off, defended to mid-on
driven nicely, on the up, with an open face, but Umar Akmal puts in a diving save at cover
short of a length, outside off, punched away, but can't beat Umar Akmal at cover
short of a length, flick-pulled to long leg for one
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
on a length, outside off, inviting a drive, but Joyce doesn't go after it
on a length, on off, defended to point with an open face
on a length, outside off, pushed to cover
short of a length, outside off, punched square, Shehzad makes a diving save at point
another good punch shot, but Pakistan fielding is on today. This time Afridi at cover saves a run with his sliding stop and throw
on the pads this time, and Porterfield loves it there. Punched away between mid-on and midwicket. Wahab's chase is fast, and he slides-and-releases the ball fast, and saves one run
short of a length, on the pads, and he has short-arm-pulled this through square leg for four
on a length, on off, runs off the inside half of the bat for one
length ball, just outside off, pushed sweetly to cover
wide length ball, driven away hard, but he has found Umar Akmal at the edge of the circle in the covers

Porterfield is targeting short square boundaries, and he is spotting the length pretty early. This is not very short, but Porterfield goes deep into the crease, prepares for the pull early, and doesn't bother keeping it down. Deep into the stands over square leg
short of a length, on middle and off, defended
short of a length, on off, pushed to point
on a length, on off, defended off the front foot

dropped. Just when we thought Pakistan were up for it in the field. He has wrongfooted himself. Short and wide, cut away in the air, Shehzad moves to his left, but the ball swerves away to his right. He gets only one hand to it. A difficult chance given that movement away from him
defended off the back foot
fuller, on off, pushed to mid-off
and once he drops ever so short, Porterfield is back and ready to pull. He has been disdainful with that shot today. Goes over midwicket this time
goes for the big flashy square cut, gets a thick edge but it doesn't carry to third man
and he starts off with a big wide. Tries a slower ball, and completely loses it. Pitches too far outside off, and moves further away
on a length, outside off, defended with an open face
lovely shot. This is on a length, outside off, he leans into it, and pushes it past short cover and also beats mid-off. He has threaded that small gap. A stiff old chase by Sohail
short and wide. Poor start by Riaz. And Porterfield is on fire today. Cuts this to the left of point. Pakistan might rue that drop
another sweet shot, beats point to his right with a punch, but third man is square
short of a length, outside off, bunts it to the right of point for one
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
short of a length, outside off, defende4d to cover
on a length outside off, runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, wide, punched down to mid-off
full, angling in, defended to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, punched away, but can't beat cover
short of a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
pulled away for one
big bouncer, bid wide, and a lovely one-handed take overhead by Sarfraz
wide length ball, driven past point for one
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
on a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot

Rahat gets the wicket. He doesn't? At least according to the umpire, he doesn't, but Pakistan have reviewed it. Umpire RSA Palliyaguruge seems to have made a very good decision. This is on a length, outside off, Joyce opens his face, their is a clear noise as the ball passes the bat. Everybody is sure he is out, but not the umpire. The replays show no clear contact between bat and ball. The snicko registers a disturbance, but a moment before the ball reaches the bat. This is a superb decision, ump, because it sounds out live time
defended off the front foot
short of a length, just outside off, defended off the back foot

and a loose ball on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket. The keeper shouts out, "Tappe pe de, tappe de." [Throw it on the bounce.] They want reverse, and there is nothing wrong really with throwing on the bounce from the deep
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
driven on the up, to deep cover
short of a length, outside off, looks to punch this, gets an inside edge to fine leg
driven on the up, gets a single to deep point

Wahab produces the breakthrough for Pakistan. He just has the knack. Joyce looks to pull from outside off, the ball gets a touch big on him, and he is late into the shot. The top edge lobs up towards short square cover, and Umar Akmal doesn't drop it. Wahab's deceptive pace does it
short of a length, outside off, runs this down, fine of third man
short and wide, he follows it, reaches it, and cuts it between point and cover-point
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
defended off the front foot
length ball, angling in, worked past mid-on for a couple
on a length, outside off, driven on the up, to mid-off
bouncer, Porterfield pulls out of the pull. Called wide on height
this one holds up a little. On a length, angling in, Porterfield is early into his push, and has to check it at the last moment. The ball rolls to mid-on
nice wristy flick. A touch too full, a touch too straight, flicked away wide of mid-on and straight of deep midwicket
short of a length, wide, throws his bat at it, gets an edge that flies over where second slip would have been. Gets four as the ball spins away, finer of third man
on a length, just outside off, holds its line a touch. Defended to cover
length ball, on off, defended off the front foot

this match is turning out to be a great contest. No team is holding back. Riaz has been bowling bouncers despite some pulled boundaries, and Ireland are attacking despite a wicket in Wahab's last over. Pulled away over midwicket for four
full, down the leg side. Called a wide
short of a length, punched away to square leg for one
short of a length, tucked away off the hip
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
paddled away to long leg for one
flighted outside off, driven to deep cover for one
short of a length, pushed to short straight midwicket
flighted outside off, lovely cover-drive by Porterfield. He has placed this in front of deep cover-point. Porterfield is playing a gem here
defended with an open face
flighted outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
short of a length, on off, defended to cover
full, outside off, defended to cover
on a length, outside off, soft hands, between point and cover, gets a single

a wicket against the run of play. This ball has stopped at him. Short of a length, wide, he looks to punch but the ball doesn't quite come on. So instead of going square, he ends up hitting this to short cover where Umar Akmal takes a smart catch to his right
short of a length, just outside off, left alone
short of a length, outside off, punched away in front of point and gets a couple
pitches just a little short of the driving length, and he stays back to punch this into the leg side for one
short of a length, flat, punched down back to him. Afridi puts in a dive to field
slower through the air, punched down to long-off for one
on a length, angled across him, pushes it with an open face, gets a single
short of a length, angling into the pads, turned to short fine leg
flat, short of a length, defended to short midwicket
too straight, angling down the leg side, he just needs to get some bat on this, and he nudges this fine of short fine for four
short of a length, not short enough to cut, which is why gets a bottom edge on this. Safe
on a length, angling in, pushed to leg
full, just outside off, defended back to him
short of a length, on off, defended with an open face
short, just outside off, holds up again, Porterfield gets his timing all wrong on the cut. The ball rolls off the underside edge
flighted on off, defended from the crease
flatter, quicker, legbreak, beats his edge as he looks to punch
this one doesn't turn, and is punched to deep cover for one
pushed across him, gets a thick edge on the drive, to short third man
flighted on off, pushed back to him
flat, on off, punched back to him. Just one off the over
short of a length, into the pads, worked to leg side for one
punched away past point for another single
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
defended off the back foot again as Adil stays short of a length
stays short of a length, just outside off, draws another defensive shot
on a length, angling in, pushed back to Adil
plays for the legbreak, the ball doesn't turn in, takes the edge outside off, but there is no slip as you would expect with a batsman on 62
clipped away off the pads for one
pushed into the pads, flicked to short fine leg
driven to deep cover
driven, but straight to cover
slower, on middle and leg, defended to leg
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
short of a length, wide, punched to deep cover for one
short of a length, outside off, runs this down, square of third man, comes back for the second
short of a length, holds its line in front of leg, gets an inside edge onto the pad
short of a length, again holds up in the surface, takes a leading edge as he looks to work this to leg
short of a length, just outside off, runs this down to third man for one
and Porterfield laps this away to where that slip fielder would have been had they not brought in the slip. Intelligent batting
quicker delivery, opens the face, guides it wide of slip. but can't beat backward point
pushed down to long-on
calculated risk. The field is up in the circle on the off side, and he throws his arms at a wide delivery to clear wide mid-off
Afridi fires this in at 96ks, beats the outside edge
pushed wide of cover for one
on a length, holds its line, defended from the crease
on a length, outside off, driven on the up, to deep cover
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover
short of a length, angling away, holds up a touch, which means he ends up punching uppishly and in front of square. Doesn't carry to short cover
on a length, middle and leg, defended to midwicket
drives on the up, but the lack of pace on this makes it difficult to time it. Played to short cover
nice drift and then some turn away from him. Defended back to him
short of a length, on off, pushed to cover
flighted outside off, really slow through the air, driven past the diving Akmal at short cover
flighted outside off, driven with an open face, gets a single past point
dip on it, holds its line, defended off the front foot
tossed up on off, pushed down to long-off for one
short-arm pull from ouside off, not the best timing, but placed wide of mid-on. A misfield from Misbah concedes two extra runs
wide half-volley, driven hard, but straight to short cover
full, on off, pushed to mid-on
length ball, outside off, driven on the up, but straight to short cover
wide outside leg as Porterfield is beaten on a flick there. This does seem to have kissed the thigh pad
driven on the up, in front of cover, comes back for the second
pushed straight to mid-off
overpitched on the pads, driven to long-on for one
on a length, holds its line outside off, pushed away for a single wide of point
on a length, middle and leg, pushed to long-on
flighted on middle and leg, flicked away down the ground, but can't beat short straight midwicket
flighted outside off, comes in, hits the inside half of the bat
pushed across, outside off, runs off the outside half of the bat
on a length, middle and leg, defended back to him
short of a length, middle and leg, defended
short of a length, just outside off, defended from the crease
short of a length, outside off, punched away nicely, but Shehzad puts in a diving save at point
this short ball gets a bit big on him, but the mistimed pull doesn't go to hand
short-arm pull as this is short and only waist high. Gets a single to deep square and moves into the 80s
clipped away off the toe for a single
short of a length, outside off, punched away to deep cover for one
clipped away off the pads. Sohaib Maqsood misfields in the deep backward square region. Allows them the second

oh what a soft dismissal, and against the run of play. That misfield has proved to be a work for genius. Balbirnie stays on strike thanks to that misfield and plays this poor sweep. He hasn't really gone down on this length ball outside off, gets a massive top edge that Afridi takes at short fine leg. He also has to fetch this from well outside off. Premeditated
punched straight of deep cover for a couple
defended off the front foot as this is tossed up outside off

that's not great by Rahat. This is a thick edge towards third man, Rahat is running in, but at the last moment gives up the pursuit to try to save four. In the end he is just a couple of quick-paces-v-slow-paces from the catch. If I were bowling I would have wanted him to go for the catch even if it means conceding four
defended off the back foot
length ball outside off, defended off the front foot
looks to cut, gets a bottom edge for a single
bouncer, middle and leg, ducks under it
that's a quick ball. Effort ball. On a length, outside off, and beats his drive
down the wicket to drive this to long-on for one
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
short of a length, on off, pushed wide of cover for one
punched away off the pads for a single to deep square
pushed wide of cover for one
driven hard, but back to him
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
leading edge as he looks to punch this to square leg. It chips over midwicket and Porterfield is safe
slight shimmy down the wicket, defends this to cover. The throw nearly cleans him up
another shimmy down the pitch, Afridi bowls fast, defended again
tossed up outside off, slower through the air, gets an inside edge as he looks to drive
slow through the air, but a touch short, and cut away for a single to deep point
short, cut away to deep point
lovely shot. Tossed up outside off, he reaches its pitch, but also makes that slightest bit of room to drive this wide of mid-off for four. he is into the 90s now
full, middle and leg, pushed to long-on
down the wicket, not to the pitch of it, and defends it back to him
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off for one
flat, outside leg, easy call for a wide
flicked away but straight to square leg
nice little lebgreak, pretty tight on middle and leg, defended back to him
short of a length, goes back to punch it, but can't beat short straight midwicket
flighted outside off, pushed to deep cover for one
tossed up outside off, driven wristily to long-on for one
makes room to look to drive into the covers, but this legbreak doesn't turn, and goes off the inside half of the bat

Porterfield is nearly run out in the 90s. This is fired into the pads, runs towards square leg, Porterfield wants the leg-bye, Wilson doesn't budge. Porterfield runs halfway up the pitch and comes back and puts a dive in. The throw from Sarfraz is not hard enough
on a length, into the pads, worked away into the leg side for one
short of a length, angling across him, pushed to deep cover for one
on a length, pretty accurate. Not too straight, and no room outside off. Defended back to him

short of a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on off the back foot. They think this is a risky single because he is starting from deep inside the crease, but the fielder at mid-on doesn't even move. That's poor
short of a length, gets some width, cuts this in front of third man for two
full and wide, angling away, beats the drive, but it has been called a wide
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, tucked away off the pads for one

short of a length after he sees him advance, draws a bottom edge onto the pad. They take a non-existent single, Sohail fields and throws at the non-striker's end. Had he hit the stumps or even the batsman he was gone because Wilson has changed direction while running
short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
full, swinging in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, tucked away off the hip to move to 99
short, wide, and Wilson cuts deliberately in air and clears the man at point for four

he has dropped him on 99. Driven on the up, fails to keep it down, but it bursts through Rahat's hands. Comes back for two. Removes his helmet to celebrate. KOB leads the applause from the dressing room. Sarfraz claps too. Good spirit out there. It hasn't burst through. Rahat has attempted a catch at the wrong line. Gets hit on the low finger, and the ricochet nearly runs Wilson out, who is backing up
wide length ball, driven in front of cover, beats deep cover. Porterfield is playing a gem
short of a length, outside off, cut away to third man for one
cut away for a single
on a length, angling in towards off, pushed back at Rahat
full, into the pads, pushed to mid-on, and seeing that it is Wahab at mid-on they don't risk the single. Wahab is a good fielder
short of a length, steered away to third man for one
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
stays back to try to punch a length ball, and is beaten

this could just be his last game, but Afridi is doing his best to make sure he isn't. Porterfield looks to drive over mid-on but mistimes. The length ball just gets a little big on him, and lobs off the high part of the bat. Afridi rushes in from the edge of the circle and takes a low diving catch to his left. Porterifeld out for 107. His seventh score between 100 and 112
full, just outside off, squeezed past pint for a single
backs away, Afridi bowls a legbreak following him. He has to defend this back to him
down the wicket, Afridi drags his length back, and Wilson has to defend

Afridi bowls short and wide after two good balls, and is cut away for four despite a dive in the deep. Afridi not happy with the effort. Adil is the fielder, and while he dives he has jammed his knee into the soft outfield
short of a length, goes back to punch this in front of point for one
short of a length, outside off, defended to point
flatter, short delivery, punched to mid-on. Afridi is done for the day. Now up to the other bowlers and batsmen to make sure he plays another match. Good figures of 10-0-38-0

Lovely inswinging yorker, given out lbw but Wilson has reviewed it immediately. This has dipped and swung in late, and has hit him in front, but Wilson has got a big inside edge. Marais Erasmus reverses his own decision. It looked out live time. This is a perfect endorsement of DRS
bouncer, too high, called a wide
more late swing. This could be reverse. Beats his inside edge, but is headed down leg

bouncer, he looks to upper-cut it, Wilson is off his feet in trying to do so, still can't reach it, and gets a soft top edge on it. The third man boundary from this end is the longest part of Adelaide Oval. Wahab takes a confident catch. This could have been a wide had he not hit, but is only the second bouncer of the over so it can't be called a no-ball
short of a length, on the pads, worked away for a single
on a length, angling in, slight swing too, hits the inside half of the bat and goes to mid-on
full on off, driven to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover
short of a length, pitched outside leg, runs off the thigh pad for a leg-bye
on a length, pretty accurate, defended back to him
short of a length, outside off, seams away a touch, beats the outside edge
short of a length, swings back in touch, beats the inside edge, hits the thigh pad
full, swinging in, pushed wide of mid-on for a single
beats him with a full reversing delivery. Full and coming back, past the inside edge
bouncer, just outside off, he leaves it alone
full outside off, dug out for a single to cover
KOB's first run, off the sixth ball he has faced. Toe-ends this short ball to third man
full, outside off, driven in front of deep cover for two. Slower ball
length ball, outside off, punched to third man for one
quick length ball, angling in, he drops this at his toes and takes a single
short of a length, worked off the pads for one
full, on off, swings away a touch, gets a thick edge on the drive, but it goes wide of slip and fine of third man for four
lovely drive on the up, but straight to short cover

good bowling. Pakistan are bowling to bowl Ireland out and not restrict them. This is a mean bouncer, cramping him and getting it chin high. Thompson looks to pull but ends up slicing it off the top edge to short cover
bunted for a single into the leg side
full and straight, pitched outside leg, beaten, hit on the pad
full outside off, driven square, but straight to point
short, rib high, he flicks it away with his eyes taken off it. Gets a single to long leg
bouncer, too high, called a wide
full, swinging in, pushed to mid-on for one
short of a length, pitched outside leg, beats the bat, goes for a leg-bye
full, swinging in, goes off the inside half, wide of midwicket, but O'Brien turns down a single that would have given him strike
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover

another return catch dropped. This time by Wahab. Slower ball. Has done Mooney in completely. Soft offering to his right. I know there are no easy return catches in the follow-through. He expects it to come faster than it does, and drops it
bouncer, another dot. Too quick for Mooney
full and straight, on off, dug out. Another dot
slower ball, full, gets an inside edge onto the pad. They sneak in the single even though the ball is on the pitch
bouncer, he ducks it, another dot to O'Brien. Excellent death bowling so far
full and straight, dug out to mid-off for one
lovely bowling. Follows O'Brien, who is backing away, and delivers a yorker. Dug out for a dot
another full inswinging delivery, just inches short of being a yorker, and he has finally crunched this between mid-off and extra cover for four
full, swinging in, it's a half-volley, but it has followed O'Brien, who is backing away. Mis-hit to short midwicket
bouncer. This is an excellent change-up. Beats his attempt to pull

another dropped chance. This would have been a huge wicket. O'Brien makes room and gives him the charge, Sohail bounces him, O'Brien goes ahead with the pull, straight to deep square leg where Adil refuses a low offering
that drop doesn't cost Adil at all. He will be very relieved. A proper mean bouncer at 147ks from Wahab. And it has followed him as he backs away. No room to hook. Gets a top edge to midwicket
length ball outside off, Mooney swings, gets a thick edge to third man for one. This is bowled at 148ks
short of a length, on off, opens the face, guides this past point for one
slower legcutter, makes room tu punch this ton deep point
short of a length, outside off, steered to third man, and they steal the second
bouncer, no room, he has let this go through to the keeper
yorker, middle and leg, dipping, reversing. He keeps it out. Gets a single
makes room, that's dangerous to his yorkers. This is a low full toss, though, and they get a single to deep cover
the yorker goes wrong. Low full toss outside off. Mooney makes room and slices this over point for four
slower ball, short of a length, punched to deep point for a couple
ramped it into his own throat. Oh he is looking to go over fine leg, but he has played this full toss straight into his throat. Gets into an awkward position. He is in pain but will continue batting
on a length, outside off, beats him
short of a length, no room, pushed to point for one

Wahab has another wicket. Umar Akmal gets his fourth catch. On a length, Mooney finally gets one that he can get under and hit. He hits but doesn't quite get the elevation. Akmal pouches it at short midwicket. This is bowled at 150ks
full and straight, dug out to long-on
he goes length. Maybe he is greedy for a wicket, looking for a mis-hit from the tailender. Dockrell doesn't make a mistake. He makes room, clears the front leg, and lofts this over midwicket
he is anticipating a short ball, moves across the line to try to help it over fine leg. Beaten by pace

swings and misses at a short ball, steals a bye, there is a direct hit at the non-striker's end, and Dockrell is run out by inches. Tell you what, he has run straight into Umar Akmal who has come to collect the throw. Apologises immediately
